results.content:
keep in mind this course is for an older version of cakePHP (2.x) and the boys over at cakePHP made some serious changes with v3 so this tutorial is a bit outdated.

having said that, it will help you get a basic understanding of how cakePHP works which will make it easier to jump into v3 should you decide to do that.

if you don't have a solid grasp on php (and programming in general) this course is going to be rough for you as the instructor assumes you know and understand some basic (and not so basic) principals of php but overall it's still a really good course and worth the time if you're wanting to dive into cakePHP.

the instructor has a strong accent but he's not hard to understand and with a few minor exceptions he does a good and thorough job of explaining cakePHP.

results.content: There isn’t much in Udemy on CakePHP, but this course is exactly what I was looking for.  The instructor covered the important stuff I need to know to get things working.  I like how Ivan explains things and the manner in which he presented the material shows how each one are linked and how they all tie together.  I did look around on CakePHP tutorials, but nothing compares to this. His explanation on things is something you cannot find from tutorials. He is also quick in responding to questions.   I wish he makes an advanced course on this, and if he does, I will surely sign up for it. Thanks!

I like how Ivan explains things and the manner in which he presented the material shows how each one are linked and how they all tie together. I did look around on CakePHP tutorials, but nothing compares to this. His explanation on things is something you cannot find from tutorials. He is also quick in responding to questions. I wish he makes an advanced course on this, and if he does, I will surely sign up for it. Thanks!

results.content: This course made understanding how to get started with CakePHP a cinch. It's a no BS introduction and gives you the meat of starting out with Cake and none of the fluff as with other CakePHP tutorials. Ivan answered all my questions about setting up the view and keeping everything modular. This is the best course to take, that I've found on the internet, for getting to know CakePHP. This is a high production quality course!

results.content: It was a whirlwind tour that shows you all the basics without wasting a lot of time belaboring any one point. I may rewatch it and pause and work along with the examples. However, I feel there should have been a chapter added at the end (once you understand the behind the scenes workings) explaining the bake functionality, which is one of the most powerful things about this framework in my opinion.
